image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a hoodie and bowler hat in a park

props.synopsis: Former Alice Springs Coles worker Gene Hill says it was clear an Aboriginal man who died in police custody at the supermarket last week had a disability and needed extra support.

title.children: Coles staffer says man who died in custody clearly had 'special needs'

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and glasses leans down to talk to an Indigenous person.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited coronial findings into the 2019 death in custody of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker will be delayed by a month, after the death of another Warlpiri man in Alice Springs last week.

title.children: Kumanjayi Walker inquest findings delayed after death in custody

image.altText: A black plastic bag full of cannabis

props.synopsis: Police say a drug bust that netted 113kg of cannabis and $170,000 in cash has disrupted a sophisticated, cross-border Vietnamese crime gang trafficking large quantities of illegal drugs into the Northern Territory.

title.children: Police say 113kg drug bust 'strikes at the heart' of Vietnamese crime gang

image.altText: Man in high-viz mining gear next to row of trees.

props.synopsis: Rio Tinto has become Australia's largest producer of pongamia trees — to be used to make biofuel — as it aims to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels.

title.children: Rio Tinto starts native seed farms to fuel mining fleet

image.altText: Close up of a phone with SpaceX connectivity

props.synopsis: An Australia-first service using satellites to deliver text messages anywhere in the country promises to provide service to those living in mobile black spots.

title.children: Direct-to-satellite text messaging service gets first Australian users

image.altText: A man's eye illuminated by a light.

props.synopsis: In the Top End, cataracts often go untreated for years, becoming dense and leathery. A roving surgery team is tackling the backlog and restoring sight to remote Indigenous patients.

title.children: Life-changing cataract surgery restores eyesight to hunt again

image.altText: Man in a blue shirt is interviewed for TV

props.synopsis: Dennis Naroldol has pleaded guilty to manslaughter after stabbing his partner through the heart outside the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel on the Darwin Esplanade in 2023.

title.children: Man who stabbed partner through heart pleads guilty to manslaughter

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old woman has died at Royal Darwin Hospital 10 days after an alleged domestic violence attack. A man has been charged as police continue to investigate.

title.children: 22yo woman dies in Darwin hospital after alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: The rear of an ambulance driving down a wet road at dusk. The headlights of other cars can be seen shining.

props.synopsis: Distraught families say the New South Wales public mental health system abandoned their loved ones when they needed care the most — and doctors warn the crisis is only getting worse.

title.children: 'Days later she was dead': Families devastated by a collapsing mental health system

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers in front of a black background.

props.synopsis: The proposal to tax earnings for super balances over $3 million, including on unrealised gains, is the subject of renewed controversy following the federal election.

title.children: How does Labor's new super tax work and why is it controversial?

image.altText: A man poses smiling next to some mangoes on a tree.

props.synopsis: A 51-year-old man dies after being hit by an e-scooter allegedly being ridden by a woman under the influence of alcohol in Perth's CBD.

title.children: Breaking: Perth father dies after being hit by e-scooter in alleged drunken crash

image.altText: A crypto ATM is seen on a street with a man walking behind it.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing millions of dollars each year to scams involving cash deposits at cryptocurrency ATMs — machines authorities warn are increasingly being exploited by criminals for money laundering.

title.children: Older Australians losing millions in scams involving crypto ATMs

image.altText: Matthew Miller stands at a State Department podium.

props.synopsis: Matthew Miller, the former top US State Department spokesperson who sparred with journalists when they raised allegations of war crimes, now says Israel has "without a doubt" committed war crimes in Gaza.

title.children: Biden spokesman who defended Israel now says it committed war crimes

image.altText: A woman having a cosmetic injectible in her lip.

props.synopsis: The Australian health practitioner regulator introduces sweeping new guidelines for dentists and nurses performing non-surgical cosmetic injectable procedures, in a bid to better protect consumers.

title.children: 'Crystal clear' new rules for nurses, dentists performing cosmetic injectables

image.altText: Keir Starmer speaks at a lectern with a crowd of people behind him

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says the "moment has arrived to transform how we defend ourselves" but has not given a date for when UK defence spending will rise to 3 per cent of GDP.

title.children: UK to radically change its defence approach to address Russian threats

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff appears to be in thought, surrounded by his colleagues.

props.synopsis: A no-confidence motion has been tabled by Labor targeting Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff over the state budget debt and his handling of the Spirit of Tasmania replacement project. Convention dictates a premier should resign if such a motion is successful.

title.children: No-confidence motion targeting Tasmanian premier tabled by Labor

image.altText: a long slver fish washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: When Sybil Robertson took a stroll at Ocean Beach on Monday, she was unaware she was about to join the small and exclusive club of people who have found an oarfish.

title.children: Dog walker finds elusive 'doomsday' fish on remote Tasmanian beach

image.altText: The back of two people in police uniforms walking through a crowd at night.

props.synopsis: Police investigating an anonymous social media post containing a "stabbing list" say it is not connected to an alleged triple stabbing in Dubbo.

title.children: Police investigate social media 'stabbing list' posted before town show

image.altText: Joanna Pascua

props.synopsis: Joanna Pascua wins the right to Australian workplace protections despite living almost 6,000 kilometres away. Lawyers say she paved the way for legal claims, including class actions, against employers by "exploited" offshore workers.

title.children: Filipino woman changes the game for Australia's 'exploited' offshore workers

image.altText: A golden coloured dog in the arms of a firefighter.

props.synopsis: Ted the Labrador is rescued unharmed from an 8-metre-deep mine shaft in Central Victoria, four days after escaping his backyard with labradoodle Penny.

title.children: Missing for four days, Labrador Ted turns up in a mine shaft

image.altText: Close up of PA hospital sign.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has died two days after an altercation with another mental health patient at the Princess Alexandra Hospital's psychiatric ward, in Brisbane's south.

title.children: Prisoner dies after altercation with patient in Brisbane psychiatric ward

image.altText: People cross at an intersection in Brisbane CBD in June 2018.

props.synopsis: Minimum and award wages will lift 3.5 per cent from July 1. Australian shares have opened higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Minimum wage to rise above inflation, ASX on the rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Current account deficit narrows but trade a drag
Employment minister speaking on minimum wage rise

image.altText: Madeleine McCann

props.synopsis: The disappearance of British toddler Madeleine McCann remains unsolved after 18 years. Now Portuguese and German police have launched fresh searches to find her.

title.children: What police hope a new search for Madeleine McCann uncovers

image.altText: A logo says 'ASIC'.

props.synopsis: ASIC is suing insurance comparison provider Choosi for allegedly accepting $61 million in commissions to solely advertise services from one insurance company, Hannover.

title.children: ASIC accuses comparison site of promoting single insurer

image.altText: John Lennon and Yoko Ono sit near a piano and guitar in an interior space with visible window frames

props.synopsis: One To One: John & Yoko takes us inside the lives of the famous couple as they agitate for revolution in their new home city of New York.

title.children: New doco might make you rethink John Lennon and Yoko Ono's impact in the 70s

image.altText: Four men arrested on the front yard of a home in Wetherill Park

props.synopsis: Seven men have been charged by police after a multi-agency taskforce working for almost two years busted a huge drug ring.

title.children: Hundreds of kilos of drugs, millions of illegal cigarettes seized in police bust

image.altText: CFA firefighting equipment hangs from hooks.

props.synopsis: Firefighting operations will be disrupted across regional Victoria as CFA union members take industrial action after six months of stalled pay talks.

title.children: Paid CFA firefighters start work bans after failed pay negotiations

image.altText: A woman with long brunette hair smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Prema Osborne left the Metropolitan Fire Service last week just weeks after the SA Employment Tribunal found travel payments to firefighters were unlawfully withheld and were "a failure of management diligence".

title.children: SA fire service's top executive leaves after damning tribunal decision

image.altText: A white headstone on a concreted grave glints in the afternoon sun.

props.synopsis: More than a century after his real name was written out of history, a chance encounter and a lucky find at a rubbish tip restore a soldier's true identity and return him to his family.

title.children: Pure luck identifies soldier buried with wrong name, solving 80-year-old mystery

image.altText: Cloud plumes coming from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna, an active volcano on the east coast of Sicily, erupted on Monday, sending tourists on the mountain running for safety.

title.children: Mount Etna suddenly erupts, sending tourists fleeing for safety

image.altText: Matildas coach Tom Sermanni stands next to Football Australia executive Heather Garriock, holding a 'Sermanni 150'  jersey.

props.synopsis: From empty fields to sold-out stadiums, former coach Tom Sermanni can barely believe the Matildas' evolution since he first took the reins in 1994.

title.children: Sermanni departs Matildas pinching himself after 'phenomenal' privilege

image.altText: HESTA logo on a wall

props.synopsis: Australia's superannuation pool is worth nearly $4.2 trillion — the funds are undoubtedly extremely adept at taking members' money. But when it comes helping members to access it, they are falling short.

title.children: Is it acceptable to be locked out of your super fund for seven weeks?

image.altText: A white middle aged man with short hair and a blue suit. He is sitting at a desk reading a report

props.synopsis: A Commonwealth Ombudsman's investigation finds Australia's child support system has been weaponised by financial abuse that is "amplified" by Services Australia.

title.children: Parents 'manipulating' child support system without consequence: report

image.altText: two people in black scuba diving suit in a large indoor pool, there is a parachute to help one person stand up

props.synopsis: Research on injured ex-service personnel before and after scuba diving exercise shows improvements, but NDIS clients are no longer able to access funding for similar therapies.

title.children: Aisla finds 'freedom' underwater. Now the NDIS is pulling the plug

image.altText: Simon Smale with Alex Kelly at Wembley Stadium

props.synopsis: Travelling half way around the world to watch a football game is not for everyone. But as Simon Smale writes, some things are more important.

title.children: Why I flew halfway around the world for one weekend to watch my team lose
